title: How to Detail a Car with a Steam Cleaner

steps.title: Vacuum the mats, carpets and upholstery.
steps.content: Vacuum the mats, carpets and upholstery. Don't forget to vacuum the trunk. Unless your steam cleaner has an integrated vacuum, steam cleaning will remove only small debris and dirt, so it is best to vacuum thoroughly first. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Use the steam lance to remove dirt and debris in hard to reach areas where your vacuum won't reach.
steps.content: Use the steam lance to remove dirt and debris in hard to reach areas where your vacuum won't reach. Try it between the seats, in the cup holders, vents and central console. Wipe off excess moisture with a cloth.

steps.title: Steam clean the seats using the triangular tool with a microfiber cloth, at minimum or medium pressure setting.
steps.content: Steam clean the seats using the triangular tool with a microfiber cloth, at minimum or medium pressure setting. For very dirty seats, you can use the triangular brush directly on the surface and scrub with the bristles to dislodge dirt. [2] X Research source Wipe off with a clean microfiber cloth. Leather seats should be cup holders after a steam treatment.

steps.title: Apply steam to the windows using the window squeegee tool or by spraying steam and wiping off moisture with a clean microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Apply steam to the windows using the window squeegee tool or by spraying steam and wiping off moisture with a clean microfiber cloth. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the side panels, ceilings, headliners with the triangular tool and a microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Clean the side panels, ceilings, headliners with the triangular tool and a microfiber cloth. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Use the triangular tool to steam clean carpets and mats.
steps.content: Use the triangular tool to steam clean carpets and mats. A slow forward motion will give the best results. [5] X Research source
